name: Red Team Testing (RT) #1 - Red team testing plan
displayName: Red Team Testing (RT) #1 - Red team testing plan
description:
| Phase | Step | Outcome |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| Red Team Testing Report | 1 of 3 | Definition of the plan for execute the test in the `Entity` |

# Tasks

- `Task #1 - Definition of the scope`
- `Task #2 - Meet with the threat intelligence team`
- `Task #3 - Make a risk plan`

# Planning the testing

During this activity of the Red Team Test Report phase, the goal is to first obtain the information generated by the TI provider, both the GTL report and the TTI report in order to understand the scenarios and intelligence generated based on the `Entity`. After understanding this information, the red team must define the scope of the tests. Which critical functions are left out and which are not. This is critical, since there will be some CF that are not in the scope and can cause loss of time for the team.

Finally, the red team must define the execution time of the tests. This allows the white team to follow the test during the execution.

# Outcome

The outcome of this case will be a summary email or report where is defined the final scope and the execution time of the test. This summary must be sent to the `Entity`.

tasks.title: Task #2 - Meet with the threat intelligence team
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on GTL Report and TTI Report from the threat intelligence provider.

# Goal

Both teams must meet to discuss the reports generated by the threat intelligence team.

The threat intelligence team must explain in detail everything described in the reports, since the information that appears in them could define the scope and basis for the scenarios that the red team team will later generate.

1. All scenarios must be described by the threat intelligence team
2. it is **important** for the red team to align their goals with the **real goals of an attacker**. Also those goals have to be mapped with the critical functions of the `Entity`
3. Finally, the red team need to adapt their methodology to repliace real-life attack scenarios. TIBER-EU was created to replicate real-world attacks, which means that it is not a simple security audit to identify vulnerabilities.

tasks.title: Task #1 - Definition of the scope
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on GTL Report and TTI Report from the threat intelligence provider.

# Goal

Your goal is understand both reports created by the threat intelligence team to help you in the following phases to create structured scenarios. 

The TTI report was made using open source intelligence, Therefore, you must take into account all the information that appears, since it could contain technology used by the `Entity` and possible existing vulnerabilities that could be exploited.

After understand those reports, the red team must to know the critical functions in the scope, since it might change the final scope defined. 

Finally, is important define the execution time of the testing. This depends of the scope and number of assests and critical functions to audit, however, a good standard could be between 10-12 weeks.

tasks.title: Task #3 - Make a risk plan
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task hasn't dependencies. 

# Goal

In the Red Team Test Plan, the RT provider should set out details of its risk management approach. The risk management approach should set out how the RT provider will take the appropriate actions before, during and after the test. 

It must be reflected how the red team team will act in case any system is left without service in the `Entity`. Methods of communication with the White Team to expedite the implementation of said services and also how confidential information will be exchanged.

For example, in the Red Team Test Plan, the RT provider should share all infrastructure, domain names, hashes, emails (i.e. so called indicators of attack), used by the RT provider, with the White Team and TCT before the test starts. This will allow the White Team to differentiate between the TIBER test and potentially real attacks, and allow the White Team to take the appropriate steps to manage a potentially real cyber attack.
